data.title: 3 Tech Stocks for Growth Investors to Buy in August
data.text: It's time to check out 3 tech stocks that came through our screen today that growth investors might want to consider as we move beyond Q2 earnings season.

data.title: Microsoft hires Apple's former Siri chief
data.text: Stasior left Apple earlier this year. Prior to his time in charge of Siri, he was a top executive at Amazon.

data.title: This Week's Game Plan - Patience Is The Name Of The Microsoft Game
data.text: We lay out our investing plan for the week, with our space and tech coverage universe in mind.  Market risk abounds.

data.title: Microsoft takes a big gulp of Java with jClarity acquisition, boosting Azure’s open-source cred
data.text: Microsoft has acquired London-based jClarity, a key player behind a popular open-source implementation of the Java software development platform, AdoptOpenJDK.

data.title: Options Bulls - Unusual Options Activity
data.text: "Halftime Report" trader Jon Najarian spots unusual options activity in shares of NVIDIA, CNH Industrial, and Microsoft.

data.title: Microsoft Acquires jClarity To Bolster Azure's Java Team
data.text: Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ: MSFT) shares are trading higher after the company announced it has acquired jClarity.

data.title: Microsoft acquires jClarity, an open source Java performance tuning tool
data.text: Microsoft announced this morning that it was acquiring jClarity, an open source tool designed to tune the performance of Java applications. It will be doing that on Azure from now on.

data.title: Nvidia and Microsoft Partner to Make World’s Best-Selling Video Game Even Better
data.text: Shares of both Nvidia Corp. (NASDAQ: NVDA) and Microsoft Corp. (NASDAQ: MSFT) saw a handy gain on Monday after the firms announced that they would be partnering to improve Minecraft, perhaps the best-selling video game of all time.

data.title: Buy 5 Dow Stocks That Have Surged Despite Market Gyrations
data.text: Some members of the Dow 30 Index have offered impressive returns in the past three months and still have upside left.

data.title: Microsoft's 'Minecraft' is getting more realistic graphics thanks to a deal with Nvidia
data.text: "Minecraft" players will be able to test out the more realistic graphics in a beta version slated for release in the new year.

data.title: Microsoft, Nvidia team up for more realistic visuals on Minecraft game
data.text: Microsoft Corp  said on Monday it will use chipmaker Nvidia Corp's  real-time ray tracing technology to provide the software company's Minecraft video game players more realistic graphics on personal computers.
